intro: Ranunculus rheithroplesius, commonly known as the Rheithroplesian buttercup, is a rare and lesser-known member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, cup-shaped flowers that typically range in color from yellow to deep orange. The plant features finely divided, palmate leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Native to specific regions in Central Asia, it thrives in moist, temperate climates with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
